pullRequest.title: CLDR-14212 finalize move to Maven
pullRequest.bodyText:
CLDR-14212

get rid of ant build files, .classpath, .project, .settings
for Eclipse, all of these are synthesized from maven (and .gitignored)
CLDR no longer requires git-lfs
deploy and consolecheck are now a part of the maven build
cldr-tools (cldr.jar) and cldr-apps (cldr-apps.war) artifacts are generated on each build

NOTE: #815 should merge before this because of churn!
NOTE: #819 should merge before this because it will otherwise be broken.

afterCommit.message:

- for Eclipse, all of these are synthesized from maven (and .gitignored)

Some TODOs around testing flow, push to production, etc.

CLDR-14212 final maven move

- get rid of ant build files, .classpath, .project, .settings
- for Eclipse, all of these are synthesized from maven (and .gitignored)
- CLDR no longer requires git-lfs
- deploy and consolecheck are now a part of the maven build
- cldr-tools (cldr.jar) and cldr-apps (cldr-apps.war) artifacts are generated on each build

nodes.bodyText: disabling these for now so that no new files are added to lfs.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@
-*.jar filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text
-*.dat filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text
-*.zip filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text
-*.gz filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text
-*.bz2 filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text
+# *.jar filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text

nodes.bodyText: How will this dependency on the version -- here 39.0 -- be handled? Is this set within the Eclipse interface, or ...?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,35 +1,48 @@
 <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><project-modules id="moduleCoreId" project-version="1.5.0">
-            
+                
+    
     
     <wb-module deploy-name="cldr-apps">
-                        
+        <wb-resource deploy-path="/" source-path="/target/m2e-wtp/web-resources"/>
+                                
+        
+        
+        <wb-resource deploy-path="/" source-path="/src/main/webapp" tag="defaultRootSource"/>
+                                
         
-        <wb-resource deploy-path="/" source-path="/src/main/webapp"/>
-                        
         
         <wb-resource deploy-path="/WEB-INF/lib" source-path="/WebContent/WEB-INF/lib"/>
-                 
+                         
+        
         
         <!-- needed? -->
-                        
+                                
+        
         
         <wb-resource deploy-path="/WEB-INF/classes" source-path="/src/main/java"/>
-                        
+                                
+        
         
         <wb-resource deploy-path="/WEB-INF/classes" source-path="/.apt_generated"/>
                 
-        <wb-resource deploy-path="/WEB-INF/classes" source-path="/src/test/java"/>
-        <wb-resource deploy-path="/WEB-INF/classes" source-path="/src/test/resources"/>
         <wb-resource deploy-path="/WEB-INF/classes" source-path="/src/main/resources"/>
-                        
+        <wb-resource deploy-path="/WEB-INF/classes" source-path="/.apt_generated_tests"/>
+        <dependent-module archiveName="cldr-39.0-SNAPSHOT.jar" deploy-path="/WEB-INF/lib" handle="module:/resource/cldr/cldr">

nodes.bodyText: "for now" -- and how will it be in the long term?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@
-*.jar filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text
-*.dat filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text
-*.zip filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text
-*.gz filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text
-*.bz2 filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text
+# *.jar filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text

nodes.bodyText: How is this triggered and how does it relate to other ways of deployment?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -51,4 +64,50 @@ jobs:
           '-Dorg.unicode.cldr.unittest.web.KeepDb=true'
         env:
           GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
-
+  check:
+    needs: build
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+        with:
+          lfs: false
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Download cldr.jar
+        uses: actions/download-artifact@v2
+        with:
+          name: cldr-tools
+          path: tools/java/target/
+      - name: run CLDR console check
+        run: java -DCLDR_DIR=$(pwd) -jar tools/java/target/cldr.jar check -S common,seed -e -z FINAL_TESTING 
+  deploy:
+    if: github.repository == 'unicode-org/cldr' && github.event_name == 'push' && github.ref == 'refs/heads/master'
+    needs:
+      - build
+      - check
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+    - name: Download cldr-apps.war
+      uses: actions/download-artifact@v2
+      with:
+        name: cldr-apps
+    - name: Deploy to cldr-smoke (experimental)

nodes.bodyText: Eclipse insert extra blank lines when a configuration file is updated. This is probably a bug in Eclipse. You may get rid of these unnecessary blank lines inserted automatically.

Use of maven release plugin to drop snapshot, tag and bump a version is a popular way to do this.
Alternatively, we may have parent pom to manage single version across modules.
It's managed by Eclipse. This is automatically generated file, so I think we don't need to worry about version much.

beforeCommit.message:
CLDR-14212 final maven move

- get rid of ant build files, .classpath, .project, but keep .settings
- for Eclipse, all of these are synthesized from maven (and .gitignored)
- CLDR no longer requires git-lfs
- deploy and consolecheck are now a part of the maven build
- cldr-tools (cldr.jar) and cldr-apps (cldr-apps.war) artifacts are generated on each build
